heaviest_rainfall.status: 36.8mm of rain was recorded as having fallen on 04 January 2025, marking an exceptional 37.2 hour precipitation event.  At times the rain was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning activity recorded in a single day is 23, which occurred on 07 September 2025 (since our records began on 11 April 2025).

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 28 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was recorded on 18 July 2025.  The total number of occurrences since 1973 number is only 62.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (232.0°) by approximately 47.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 9%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 727 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in dew point temperature (up 43.5°C), feels like temperature (up 46.6°C), outside temperature (up 47.1°C), and cloud levels (up 451 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 727.5m lower than yesterday, 450.9m lower than the past week, 339.9m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 1184m to a maximum of 3910m, averaging 1386.6m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1837.5m and 1726.6m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: A high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, humidity should not be a concern and calm and still conditions are expected. Drizzle or light rain possible, a high cloud base will mean mostly sunny conditions, and bright intervals likely. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The conditions are favourable for drying your laundry outside right now but, as always, monitor the situation for changes to the weather.
